force_http2.description: Set this to `true` to disable HTTP/1.x fallback mechanism that the underlying Go library will attempt upon connection to `api.fastly.com:443` by default. This may slightly improve the provider's performance and reduce unnecessary TLS handshakes. Default: `false`

activate.description: Conditionally prevents the Service from being activated. The apply step will continue to create a new draft version but will not activate it if this is set to `false`. Default `true`

force_destroy.description: Services that are active cannot be destroyed. In order to destroy the Service, set `force_destroy` to `true`. Default `false`

force_refresh.description: Used internally by the provider to temporarily indicate if all resources should call their associated API to update the local state. This is for scenarios where the service version has been reverted outside of Terraform (e.g. via the Fastly UI) and the provider needs to resync the state for a different active version (this is only if `activate` is `true`).

imported.description: Used internally by the provider to temporarily indicate if the service is being imported, and is reset to false once the import is finished

reuse.description: Services that are active cannot be destroyed. If set to `true` a service Terraform intends to destroy will instead be deactivated (allowing it to be reused by importing it into another Terraform project). If `false`, attempting to destroy an active service will cause an error. Default `false`

Please note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the dictionary, and discard the current items in the dictionary. `fastly_service_vcl` resource will only manage the dictionary object itself, and items under private dictionaries can not be managed using [`fastly_service_dictionary_items`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/fastly/fastly/latest/docs/resources/service_dictionary_items#limitations) resource. Therefore, using a write-only/private dictionary should only be done if the items are managed outside of Terraform

force_refresh.description: Used internally by the provider to temporarily indicate if all resources should call their associated API to update the local state. This is for scenarios where the service version has been reverted outside of Terraform (e.g. via the Fastly UI) and the provider needs to resync the state for a different active version (this is only if `activate` is `true`).

If set to `true` a service Terraform intends to destroy will instead be deactivated (allowing it to be reused by importing it into another Terraform project). If `false`, attempting to destroy an active service will cause an error. Default `false`

tls_subscription_ids.description: IDs of the subscriptions associated with the domain.

configuration_id.description: ID of TLS configuration used to terminate TLS traffic.

created_at.description: Timestamp (GMT) when the certificate was created.

domains.description: Domains that are listed in any certificate's Subject Alternative Names (SAN) list.

id.description: Unique ID assigned to certificate by Fastly. Conflicts with all the other filters.

not_after.description: Timestamp (GMT) when the certificate will expire.

not_before.description: Timestamp (GMT) when the certificate will become valid.

replace.description: A recommendation from Fastly indicating the key associated with this certificate is in need of rotation.

updated_at.description: Timestamp (GMT) when the certificate was last updated.

ids.description: List of IDs corresponding to Platform TLS certificates.

created_at.description: Timestamp (GMT) when the private key was created.

id.description: Fastly private key ID. Conflicts with all the other filters

key_length.description: The key length used to generate the private key.

key_type.description: The algorithm used to generate the private key. Must be RSA.

name.description: The human-readable name assigned to the private key when uploaded.

public_key_sha1.description: A hash of the associated public key, useful for safely identifying it.

replace.description: Whether Fastly recommends replacing this private key.

ids.description: List of IDs of the TLS private keys.

certificate_authority.description: The entity that issues and certifies the TLS certificates for the subscription.

common_name.description: The common name associated with the subscription generated by Fastly TLS.

configuration_id.description: ID of TLS configuration used to terminate TLS traffic.

domains.description: List of domains on which to enable TLS.

id.description: ID of TLS subscription. Conflicts with all the other filters.

state.description: The current state of the subscription. The list of possible states are: `pending`, `processing`, `issued`, and `renewing`.

updated_at.description: Timestamp (GMT) when subscription was last updated.

exclude_modsec_rule_ids.description: A list of modsecurity rules IDs to be excluded from the data set.

modsec_rule_ids.description: A list of modsecurity rules IDs to be used as filters for the data set.

publishers.description: A list of publishers to be used as filters for the data set.

rules.description: The list of rules that results from any given combination of filters.

tags.description: A list of tags to be used as filters for the data set.
